content: What is the difference between a lemma and a theorem in Mathlib4?
Currently, almost no difference. In the longer term, theorems may require a doc-string.

@Damiano Testa I'm curious that you said "almost" no difference... my understanding is that there's currently no difference at all

is there actually a difference, even a minor one?
theorems are mostly things inherited from Lean 3 (because that's what mathport wrote), lemmas are mostly new code written in mathlib4 (because people are lazy and lemma is easier to type)
Tidying things up is currently in progress with https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/413
Mostly because most results in mathlib are of a lemma-level of importance
Ah I see... so the keywords don't do anything different, it's just that being marked lemma vs theorem has implications re: the source of the code.
Colin Jones ⚛️ has marked this topic as resolved.
